meanings.definition: Not completely hard; somewhat firm or solid.
meanings.sent1: The cookie was semihard, not too soft or too crunchy.
meanings.sent2: The bread was semihard, making it perfect for toasting.
meanings.sent3: The semihard ice cream was a challenge to scoop out of the container.
meanings.sent4: Her semihard resolve helped her endure the difficult situation.
meanings.sent5: The semihard mattress provided just the right amount of support for his back.

meanings.definition: Of a cheese, having a texture that is between soft and hard.
meanings.sent1: The semihard cheese was easy to slice but still had a rich flavor.
meanings.sent2: The sandwich was filled with semihard cheese that melted perfectly when grilled.
meanings.sent3: The mouse nibbled on the semihard cheese, trying to decide if it was worth storing.
meanings.sent4: The semihard cheese crumbled like a delicate rock formation.
meanings.sent5: The semihard cheese added a delightful texture to the salad.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is not easily influenced or changed.
meanings.sent1: She was a semihard when it came to trying new foods.
meanings.sent2: The old tree stood tall and proud, a semihard in the face of storms.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn semihard refused to budge from his opinion.
meanings.sent4: The semihard of the group kept everyone grounded during the chaos.
meanings.sent5: The rock was a semihard, unmoved by the passing of time.
